description:
I was to meet up with my old friend...except he got caught up in his commute from Adobe to the City.

So here I am at Tiki Haven an older dude hanging with a bunch of 20 and 30 year olds. I don't know who was creeped out more: moi or the younguns. Thanks Paul!!! ( hope he reads this!!)

Seriously this out of the way Tiki inspired bar on Noriega is A-Okay. The bartender was sweet. Heck she was doing shots with patrons....that gets an A in my book.

Patrons are nice and non-douchy. Music was pretty cool too!

I am not much of a sweet booze drinker but they also had plenty on tap, plenty of shots of this and that too. 

But this bar is all about the bowl with the lit Alcohol...and if you like easy drinking, get you lit quick, what the hell hangover headaches. 

Welp Tiki Haven is for you!
author: David G.

description:
I love this place. It's a perfect spot to hang out at to have a drink with friends after a long day. It definitely isn't the biggest bar, but it still has a good vibe. Drinks are good and reasonably priced. I've been only twice and got the fire bowl both times. The first time I got raspberry and the second time I got peach. Both very delicious and you can still really taste the alcohol!

The one thing I really wanted to point out though from the first time I went is about the bartender. I understand that it's super slow and it may be boring, but it's unacceptable to be on your phone the ENTIRE time. On top of that she was eating a full meal behind the bar; never in my life I've ever seen a bartender eat their dinner behind the bar even on a slow night. Literally the biggest turn off. Every time I'd go up to her for another drink, she just looked like she did not want to help me. She didn't even greet me and my significant other when we walked in. All she said was "I need to see your ID's" okay hi I'm good how are you?! I never caught her name but she has tattoos on her arms.

The second time I went though the bartender was really sweet. Unfortunately I didn't catch her name but I hope to run into her again next time. Still giving this place 5 stars because of the service from the second time, drinks are good, and the place itself gives off a good vibe.
author: Kanella G.

description:
I've been to this bar a couple times.  I took my brother out for a bday dinner at House of Prime Rib and we decided to stop by this bar.  Came here at about 8pm Sunday night.  The vibe was super chill.  The bartender working that night Kathy was super chill and kept checking up on us.  

The coolest thing about this bar is that if you have a group of friends there are areas that have couches.  There's a room upstairs and one by the vending machine.   They also have a couple of games that are pretty fun.  My most favorite thing about this bar is that they have a music machine where if you put a dollar you can choose a song you want to play.  

I've had a couple of their drinks before, the fire bowl is a super cool experience.  Blended drink lit with fire in the middle (wayyyy cool)!!!  I'm also pretty basic sometimes, a shot of grey goose is always good!  :). My brother ordered an AMF and said it was pretty good and strong!  

Definitely a recommended bar for a relaxing Sunday night.  Kathy is an amazing bartender!!!
author: Irene M.

description: This place gets 5 stars because we had the pleasure of meeting the owner and he was super cool. There are a lot of locals who come to the bar so you get a better San Francisco vibe. It wasn't as busy when we got there but my coworker and I had a great time. The drinks they made were strong and very much appreciated. If you're near the area, I suggest you make a quick pit stop. Even before you walk in the place already had that Tiki vibe bar.
author: Liz M.

description: I really love this place, really cute and drinks are nicely priced. Other customers, as well as employees, are all friendly and welcoming. Punch bowls are cheap!!
author: Toshi P.

description:
I found this cool little spot for some drinks as I was intrigued by their Fire Bowl ($17), which serves 2-4 people. They have many flavors to choose from and even allow you to combine them, so we got the Strawberry Mango mix. Between two people, we actually finished the entire bowl even though it was a serious struggle. It's a fun experience for groups with a huge punch bowl of alcohol and seeing your drink get lit on fire. Despite that, the taste was so sweet and full of alcohol flavor. It took me back to my college days drinking AMFs to get as drunk as possible for as cheap as possible.

We later tried adding in some extra tequila to make it taste less sweet, but don't think it helped that much. So next thought was to just get extra shots on its own, which was cheap at only $5.

I was getting pretty buzzed from the drink from there and needed something tasty. Good thing they have a vending machine for some drunchies. I got myself a small bag of hot fries chips for $1 to recover from the Fire Bowl. This was definitely more of a locals type of spot with the bartender chatting it up with everyone at the bar.
author: Cindy Z.

description: Came in. Was kinda busy but my friend went up to the bar and the lady said to take a seat and she'd be right with us. 5 mins pass and we try to get noticed again. 5 mins pass again and literally were just getting ghosted by the one woman working. I do feel bad as she's the only person working but at the same time we walked out after 15 mins of waiting...not because we were waiting, it's that she just wouldn't acknowledge us. I guess if it's more chill it might be nice but right now, me thinks not.
author: David S.

description:
Local dive bar in the Sunset district with cool ass bartenders, awesome drinks, and a jukebox that pumps out 90s r&b music - what more could one want?!

Every time I come up north, I make a point to come by this bar. I haven't tried the flaming tiki drinks cuz that's just not my thing; I usually stick to my vodka sodas. If you start to feel peckish, there's a good Korean restaurant next door that also sells FRENCH FRIES. 

Try to come on Thursdays when Lori is working the bar. She is sassy and funny as hell and is exactly the type of bartender you'll find yourself spilling your entire life story to over a shot of Jameson. Bring her a bag of flaming hot Cheetos and she'll for sure remember your name!
author: Julie B.

description:
Some coworkers and I came here on a Saturday evening and we were able to take over the upstairs as we had that many people. Drinks from here sneak up on you though as they didn't feel strong. I think their bowls though honestly could be a bit stronger as I had a friend order 3 bowls.... for himself and he felt okay. He also don't necessarily have the highest tolerance. 

Bartenders were nice though and the drinks were tasty. Would come back again.
author: Julie L.

description: I didn't even, they had this bar here.. until my friend mentioned to me last nite. It was my 1st time here obviously.. I Luved the environment reminds me of home.. they had a couple booths and a small upstairs, they even had some board games and a vending machine.. the employees where friendly also. Kinda want to come back again soon..
author: LeAza D.

description:
It's going up on a Tuesday! At 9pm.. lol. If you're looking for a place to go and chill with some friends and with tons of space to hang out - this is the place to go! 

We had about 30 people.. the bartenders are great! Took our orders and re-took our order like super fast! Make sure u bring cash! $15 min on card!

Tuesday's are $2 Stellas! So yes! Def bring cash!!!

There's a few more variety of beers on tap!

*Overall* great place to hang out with friends to chill! 4 stars!
author: Mindy Y.

description: I tried the fireball it didn't seem like it was strong at all until I left I had a nice buzz
author: Honey H.

description: Cool place.. there is also a private balcony upstairs to reserve and get bottle service. Of course the number one reason I luv it here because of my sexy luv Bartendar Stephanie. She makes this place rock!
author: Christy V.

description: Hubby and I drove by the Haven over the course of years - until one day we found a parking space on the way home, and decided to give it a try. We are both aficionados of tiki bars. On our first visit, Hubby asked whether the simple syrup in the mai tai was house made, and the bartender kindly said: "Oh, actually, this is a DIVE tiki bar." We were hooked - and now stop by pretty much every Tuesday night. Zombies are our poison, especially when crafted by Terrance, who is a great bartender with an open, friendly vibe - he is good to everyone. Long live Tiki Haven.
author: Amy B.

description:
Small bar with quite the crowd at night. 
A super cool bouncer named Klark with a metal gauntlet guards this haven. 
Drinks are kinda expensive tbh. Lots of random arcade games on the first floor and some board games on the 2nd floor!
author: Leo W.

description:
Went here for a friend's birthday last weekend and was immediately impressed! Intimate environment with great rum drinks and firey scorpion bowls you'd expect but also has board games to play while you hang out -- always a plus in my book. 

For a small bar there are a decent amount of tables, including an upstairs space in the back where you can convene as a group. 

It's certainly a trek from downtown but a worthy trip!
author: Liina P.

description:
Pretty good I like their cocktails! 
Went there on Friday night and it wasn't so busy 
Friendly bartenders made orders quick 
Been there twice , would comeback again
author: Bryan D.

description:
The best stories always involves a tiki bar. 

You know this is true. 

For some reason the decorations along with long colorful straws in various equally themed slushy drinks makes everyone more...happy. 

Happy=drunk. Drunk = good times. 

The booth in the back comfortably accommodated  my party of 7 while the lovely drinks we were served kept us laughing for hours. 

The board games and juke box made the night perfect. I'm not saying we played the games correctly or that my weird musical choices made everyone as happy as it made me...I'm saying it added to the fun. 

Great bartenders, boozy slushy drinks, so many group shots on a night out with great friends? 

Easiest 5 stars ever.
author: Jennifer C P.

description:
Tiki Haven is a go to bring friends for for tiki drinks and games. 

The Outer Sunset stop belongs on any list of SF tiki bars. Board games and dice cups available. Flatscreens tuned in to local sports. Burgeoning barcade in its own right - flat screen dedicated to gaming in the back. Have seen Gamecube loaded with mario-kart, and recently retro arcade games (Street Fighter 2) available. My understanding is they're looking to bring in some additional gaming cabinets.
author: David G.

description:
So I have been here twice once on a Friday night and as of recently on a Tuesday night 1/31/2018. I have got to say that this is a great place to socialize with good friends or catch a fruity alcoholic beverage. This place has a menu so you aren't lost in sauce when you decide to order your drink, I must warn you that these drinks are sweet AF in other words they will creep up on you. 

Yesterday I ordered the zombie because my tolerance has been high and I needed a alcoholic beverage that's a little stronger then the usual fruity drinks here & it was very satisfying the drink had 4 types of rum and I think pineapple juice. 

When it comes to the venue there are tables against the wall and some games in the back as well as some board games in the front.

Two restrooms in the back which are for both sexes I don't know if I can agree to that idea only because guys pee standing and I wouldn't trust a drunk guy peeing in the right direction after a few drinks. 

Also there are no appetizers offered at this location but there's a restaurant next door where they allow you to order take out and bring into the bar to munch on. 

Parking is easy to find and it's in a well lit location but because San Francisco car theft is on the rise I recommend you take all your belongings and place it in the trunk. 

Overall with my experience here i would recommend it to anyone who wants a good positive vibe with good people and friendly bartenders who attend to you when you need a drink ASAP.
author: Marilyn A.

description:
Thursday extended happy hour is until 8pm.
I love the atmosphere of here, how bartender interacts with people, the drink is always fresh and tasty.
If you are in the area, or even a bit far, you should try!
author: Natsu Y.

description:
My roommates decided to go out on a Tuesday night and it was probably better if we had stayed home. I heard good things about this bar, but honestly, it is nothing to rave about. You get inside and there is probably only 1 bartender, and maybe 3 people sitting inside. There isn't much space in there, let alone seats. 

There were about 4/5 of us that went and we ordered the strawberry fire bowl. This was nasty. If the drink was made correctly, I would think that it wouldn't taste like straight up alcohol, but it did. After one sip, I wanted to call it a night and leave but my roommates insisted we finish it, since it was like $20.. We didn't want to waste it, but if it was my decision, I would just leave. Maybe the bartender needs to try the drink before it is served? Don't recommend this place nor will I return. (1 star for the fire)
author: Katie L.

description:
This place is a true gem, embodying the middle of diamond in the rough
I came here on a total fluke. It was a comedy show and I wanted to meet with someone and I had a blast. The drinks were really big and tasty. There are board games and cards and FREE arcade games. I definitely recommend this place for a date night or group meetup or the first spot when you're ready to have a long night. The people there are very welcoming and nice. Parking is accessible and just an all-around good time. If you want to impress somebody have good conversation, games, and get tipsy GO HERE!
author: Rubin S.

description: What a great place to meet up with friends, have great drinks, and be comfortable. My girlfriends and I decided to have a girl's night, but we didn't want anything crazy. We were looking for a place that was great for catching up and had fun drinks. We found that here at Tiki Haven. The drinks were good and we stayed longer than expected. Definitely coming back!
author: Krystal M.

description:
Pretty chill spot; drinks weren't bad. 
Came here a Friday night and I liked the younger crowd
author: Ismael C.

description: Terrence is a great bartender and very attentive and personable. They have a lot of fun stuff like video games pinball and tiki drinks on fire.  Amen!
author: Shawn L.

description:
Came here after dinner with friends and was looking forward to their Fire Bowl. 
I was pleasantly surprised at their drinks. Definitely brought me back to Hawaii. I'm that girl that likes her sweet alcohol drinks. 
That night i felt like Goldilocks. I tried out their Lava Flow (super sweet, couldn't taste the alcohol) Shark Bite (tasted too strong, not enough sweetness for my taste) and ended the night with their Kokomo. (My fav!)
All their drinks came out in cute Tiki inspired glasses. The shots were heavily poured, the bartenders were sweet and attentive (gave us a free round of shots!) and the vibe of the place was super chill. My kinda place!
author: Mimie L.

description:
Gave this place another shot last night before grabbing dinner next door. This time, a middle aged gentleman was bartending. It was a busy night (Giants game), so it took him awhile to get to us but he was still friendly. The vibe was so much more lively this time. 

I have concluded that the trick to this place is to come:
1. when the nice guy is working
2. on game night

haha all jokes aside, will probably swing by another time.
author: Nancy C.

description:
This place has some special memories for me personally since this is where I had my first date with my boyfriend :). Not only that but this is an awesome bar for any first dates! It's very fun and festive looking so it definitely sets the mood for your night. 

Drinks: 
Passionfruit Fire Bowl ($17): This will get you messed up. It taste like a fruity slushie but has the effect of multiple shots. Definitely do not try to finish this yourself unless you have a really really high tolerance for alcohol or don't want to remember your night. It's cool how they make the fire from lighting the shot of alcohol they put in the middle. And it comes with fun bendy straws :D!! 

Amenities: 
They have a lot of games to play while you sit and drink. Some of the games on the first floor are fairly new but the ones upstairs are often sticky and gross. Not surprising since most people spill their alcohol on them when they have too much fun. 

Service: 
When the bar is empty (which it sometimes is even on a Fri or Sat), the bartender is quick to get your order. However when it gets busy, expect to wait for awhile since they tend to cater to the people sitting at the bar. 

Overall: 
Very cool place to grab a drink with your friends or date since you don't see much of these bars in SF. I definitely prefer this place over Smuggler's Cove since it's not as crowded and parking is easy to find.
author: Annie V.

description:
Visited on a Thursday night expecting a fun experience, but this bar was straight up dead. There was one bar tender, and probably like 4 other customers in the entire bar. We contemplated leaving but decided to give it a try since we were already there.

Drinks: Their drinks are relatively cheap in comparison to other bars in the city. We ordered:
Tiki Island $8
(Vodka, gin, rum, tequila, OJ, pineapple & cranberry)
Mango Banana Colada  $8
(Mango, banana liquor, rum, pineapple & coconut)

Their drinks were just okay. They seemed a bit too sweet for my taste and somewhat watered down. Nothing to rave about. 

Service: There was one bartender. She looked bored out of her mind!@# She had to be attentive because we were the only customers at one point. Honestly, if I had been her I'd want my shift to be over asap too.

Atmosphere: Like I said, this bar was dead. (I wish it hadn't been cause their music was on point!) We left after one drink because it was so empty we might've just stayed at home for equally the same vibe. ZZzzzzzZ......I'll pass on Tiki Haven.
author: Stefany Z.

description: Long over due review but this bar is great! We had such a sweet bartender and the fish bowls are delicious! The price is affordable and its a nice place to hang out and chill with some friends. This is place I would recommend to others and come back to myself.
author: Catherine L.

description: Cozy place to cool off after a long day at work! Plus there's a jukebox.
author: Julio B.

description:
If I were a pirate, I would much prefer Tiki Haven--girly though it may sound--to the touristy and gentrified Smugger's Cove by Downtown.  Tucked away in a quiet neighborhood close by a few restaurants and Asian dessert cafes in the Outer Sunset, it's very divey (complete with board games!  Even better and divier, Connect Four and Jenga with missing pieces!)

Somehow they manage to pull off a divey feel and thorough tiki theme without coming off as tacky--all the furniture with the totem faces are none but endearing, and with straw and bamboo everywhere, there is nothing awkward and out-of-place (except maybe for the TV's,  but they serve a legit purpose).  

They have good specials each day of the week!  Since we came on a Wednesday and are on grad student budgets, we got the fire bowl and chose the pina colada flavor.  Although the flame wasn't as impressively flashy as those at Smuggler's Cove (meh... that's for tourists and people with an objective of getting likes on Instagram/Vine videos rather than the actual bar experience), I think it tasted better: Smuggler's Cove just tastes like straight up Jamba Juice, while at Tiki Haven is alcoholic Jamba Juice.
author: Edna C.

description:
You know you're an alcoholic I mean Yelp elite when you know tiki havens weekly specials and always take a weekly snap chat of yourself under the tiki haven with clouds surrounding you! Anyways, I love love love tiki havens weekly special and love seeing many sf college friends over there! It's a great welcoming place to meet up with people and it doesn't break the bank!

Also I love that they have fun games like Jenga to keep your drunk buzz going. I also don't recommend putting a tiki bowl on the table while you are playing Jenga. My drunk self did that the last time and all our jenga pieces fell into the bowl And some caught on fire!!! But speaking of tiki bowl, they have a good deal on Wednesday nights and the tiki bowls are pretty cheap to share! I usually love getting a good two for the night and I'm set and hung over the next morning! Jk but they are creepers!!! Come check out tiki haven and you won't regret it!!!
author: Eric Joseph D.

description: This is a tiki dive! I mean this in a good way.  Drinks are sugary but inexpensive. We would go back if we were in the hood!
author: Disco B.

description:
Yay for Tiki bar in the sunset! 

They sell a lot of tiki tropical drinks *careful! The alcohol hides behind the sugary good stuff. Also quite a collection of beers and regular shots.

My favorite though, is their fire bowl, it's a slushy and spiked tropical mix in a bowl. You can share this with 3-4 other people. And they light the bowl in a little fire! 

The ambience is casual, hip hop music, and there are a lot of seatings! So definitely a good place to go with a group of 5-6. They also stream sport games! So this bar is literally all kinds of bar just not tiki.

Cheers!
author: Inge C.

description:
I've had this bookmarked for awhile (totally forgot about it) and I stopped by here because my cousin recommended it for my friend & I on a Friday night.  So many years ago I was all over the fruity sweet as hell drinks..you know...strawberry daquiris, B&J wine coolers, Chevy's fruity margaritas.  While, I still don't like pretty strong alcoholic drinks these sweet drinks just don't agree with me as much anymore.  I got a mango banana colada and my friend got a pina colada (both $8).  Mine was a little heavier on the alcohol than hers, but she asked for a little more rum & got it.  Nice fruity flavor, but really sweet still.  

Tiki Bar has a large enough cocktail menu, standard prices, friendly bartenders, cute decor and a chill crowd.  Boys & girls...on Fridays you get leid here!  Will try to come back sometime for happy hour.
author: Cat C.

description:
Super cute little bar, a lot of parking out in front & the 28 bus is only a couple blocks away. It's pretty small inside but all the decorations are really cute lol. My friends and I came in here randomly one day cause we wanted to grab a drink, ended up getting the special for the night, Pina Colada LOL. Don't be fooled, my friend and I got pretty buzzed off just one, and we also decided to take a shot. The bartender was super friendly, but the downer was that in order to pay with card, you need to have a certain limit, not quite sure if its $10 or $20, but besides that its pretty fun inside

Definitely a cool spot to just hang out and catch up with some friends!
author: Carrie L.

description: I've gone here a couple of times now and I've been impressed with the service I've received! Everyone is so nice and welcoming with a smile. Especially the guard outside, Clark, I believe. The drinks can do a little work, but as long as they get me wasted I'm all for it! There's also an arcade game in there that's fun to play when you're all messed up and what not. The atmosphere is nice and I would definitely come back on my bar hopping nights!
author: Fiona H.

description:
Drinks was ok, nothing to crazy. Ordered fire ball Piña colada it was cool
Because of the fire in the middle but the drink itself it's a bit bland. Maybe next time
I'll try the peach someone told me peach is better.
author: Lyn D.

description: Local bar has a nice catchy name n decor outside. Nothing special inside. They have 3 TV and room is pretty spacious.
author: Marlui A.

description:
Visited on a recent Saturday night, and was happy with the service and vibe. Not what I expected in this part of the Sunset, but am glad this place livens up an otherwise boring stretch of Noriega. 

I was feeling 'tropical' so naturally I had a piña colada. Aside from the excessive sugar this drink would take on my body (and my fit goals), I enjoyed it. My drinking friends also enjoyed their adult beverages. Prices were wallet friendly.

Our bartender/server was especially helpful even though I could tell he was busy taking care of other tiki patrons -- so props to him.

Well done Tiki Haven, I'll return.
author: Cameron M.

description:
If there's one thing that I hate being called, it's being called "expensive". 

Call me pudgy. Call me oogly. Call me cray cray. 

You can even call me a pudgy oogly cray cray biatch but don't ever call me "expensive" because I will do anything and everything to prove YOU wrong. Yes, I'm talking to you, snookums!

For the price of ONE Vegas drink, can someone please tell me what happened last night?
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YMhvS3UrNY3Ft69IADFvvg?select=3eOMTo7PXNM46jwvAhjDEg#3eOMTo7PXNM46jwvAhjDEg

I may have blacked out but I'm a CHEAP DATE dammit!

OTHER NOTES:
*Friendly and attentive bartenders
*Polynesian Tiki décor with Tiki everything from totems, masks and carvings to stools and tables. 
*Happy Hour Specials: Monday-Friday 4pm-8pm ($3 Beers & Wells, $1 off Cocktails, and $15 Fire Bowls)
*Daily Specials: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YMhvS3UrNY3Ft69IADFvvg?select=3eOMTo7PXNM46jwvAhjDEg#On2bbuczEwPorqmcj7lNTw
*More of an Asian crowd both old and young
*Three Small Flat Screen TVs
*Touchscreen Internet Jukebox with Oldies to Top 40s ($.67/song)
*Snack Vending Machine
*One Restroom (for each sex)
author: Cherylynn N.

description: Great dive bar I go to whenever I visit my friends who live in the area.  They are reasonable with the drinks that can get you hammered.  Great vibe with plenty of tables and stools.  Music is always bumping and you can select your songs from the jukebox.  Lots of parking and you can get late night food from the Korean restaurant next door or the Chinese restaurant across the street.  Also cute Asian bartenders who are super friendly.  I don't get to come here or the other similar Sunset Asian bars (Dragon Lounge, Chug Pub, Firefly) as much as before since I live on the Peninsula now.  Only similar bar I've found on the Peninsula is 310 Bar and Grill in Millbrae.
author: Ill C.

description: I came here on my birthday with my boyfriend around 5 after already drinking all day since 8 in the morning. We ordered one of the bowls meant for 2-4 people, couple beers, hornito shots & 2 mixed drinks. The shots here were huge & the cocktails tasted delicious & you could actually taste the alcohol in them- unlike some places where it's more sweet than anything else. I forgot the name of our bartender, but he was great! Hooked it up with a birthday shot & definitely easy to talk to. He even gave us a bunch of recommendations on places to eat & you know your girl loves her food so this made me happy. Got hungry between drinks & he was cool with us grabbing food and bringing it back into the bar to eat. I'll be back!
author: Tammy N.

description:
Came here to meet some friends from Hawaii.

The drinks were "okay" and the service was "okay"...

I enjoyed my drink since my friends were in town. It was a bit touristy for me.

If you want that touristy hawaii experience, come here.
author: Jay B.

description:
I know why it's called an Aloha Motherfucker now. Cuz aloha means both hello and goodbye. 

The first sip is like "BAM! HELLO! Welcome to the delicious but dangerous world of tiki drinks!!" And if you're lucky enough to make it all the way down to the last sip from that awesome tiki cup, it's like "Goodbye. And good luck." 

The bartender, John, is the tiki master. He's super friendly, knows how to take care of everyone, and makes the most delicious tiki drinks! The first thing he did after we sat down was provide us with a glass of some extra of a drink he had just made. I had a sip and I knew good things were coming! On his recommendation, I ordered the Bora Bora and I loved it. I loved it so much that I was almost finished with it when he filled it back up again. So nice I had to drink it twice! 

It was a Sunday night but packed with big groups of people having a good time. The bar closes at 2 and everyone stayed to close it out. That alone says a lot about this place. So if you're looking for good drinks, delightful decor, and an all-around fun experience - come here. 

Also, they have a vending machine for your munchies :)
author: Chloe T.

description: We're always searching for the ultimate tiki bar, and this one I would describe as "chill."  It's more of a neighborhood (Sunset) bar, that they converted to a tiki-type bar.  It's not over the top in theming, but it's still pretty nice to go in and get a tiki drink.  The bartender was really cool, and the tropical drinks we ordered were really good.  Always enjoy watching sports on a big screen TV.  There were a lot of locals eating and drinking at the bar, so it seems like a good place to come in and bring your to-go dinner, and order a cocktail to pair.
author: Marie B.

description:
Local bar that has a full array of alcohol but specializes in tropical mix drinks. They carry beers on tap as well and have a few tvs to watch sports.

I like coming here because the bartenders are awesome and keep you company and make sure your glass is never empty. The decor and ambience really make the place unique. 

The bar provides a few board games, cards, and dice to keep you occupied.

They have a vending machine for snacks and jukebox for music.

I recommend coming here as they also have daily happy hour specials.
author: David H.

description: I mean it is hard to expect much from a bar in the Sunset, but overall not bad. We tried the huge tiki bowl that was on fire. It looks cool, but tastes way to sweet for my taste. The place has a cool tiki bar feel, but was rather dead on a Saturday evening (maybe it got more popping later in the night). Maybe I would come back if I am too lazy to head downtown for a drink. The bowls are not expensive though, and are good for ~3 people. If you like sweet-slushie alcohol, this can be your spot.
author: Nikita K.

description: Forgot to rate this place I loved the atmosphere and the bartenders are always nice. I had a whole fire bowl to myself and it was delicious. Definitely plan on going back again with friends :)
author: Megan G.

description:
Walked here from Ocean Beach, it's a bit of a long walk, but it's do-able.  Went on Sat 1/28/12.

Lots of stools to drink at the bar.  Many TVs.

B. picked Island Classic: Hula Girl $8 - comes in a Tiki cup w/ slice of orange, maraschino cherry, & umbrella.  I'm not much into alcohol so he drank most of it, I tried it.  A little bit like a milkshake, but has alcohol taste to it.

Daily specials available.

Happy Hr M-F 4-8p $1 off Tiki drinks, $2 off bottle, $3 well, bottle, & draught

Separate bathrooms - women's just one toilet/sink.
author: Ann L.

description:
Cute little dive bar. Sounds weird to describe a dive bar as such, but that's kind what this place is. Tiki Haven sits in kind of a random spot. Wouldn't expect a bar here at all on the same block as a boba shop and a Hong Kong style dessert place, but hey that's where it is.

Kind of a quiet Saturday night when I dropped by here, and it definitely had a local feel to it. Bartenders knew the patrons and vice versa. Felt like I was the only random in the place. Not that I got terrible service or anything though. Bartenders were pretty cool!

Drinks are your standard tiki bar fare. They've got all the classics like Mai Tai's and Pina Coladas, but they also have a bunch of specials. The one my friend got was kind of like an alcoholic Jamba Juice drank. A little too sweet for my tastes but oh wells.

They've got some pretty cool nightly specials! I like the Friday night everyone gets lei'd one. Don't know when I'll ever be back in the area, but it's nice knowing Tiki Haven is a pretty solid option to have!
author: Sean H.

description:
Pretty small bar but can accommodate parties. No food just drinks here. If you want snacks there's a vending machine in the back.

Will possibly come back to try the fire bowl.
author: Mabel Y.

description: Happy hours are good and love their Fire bowl! Bartenders are all great.. they only serve drinks but has a vending machine for snacks. We usually buy food next door at the Crew and bring it over!
author: Vany P.

description: Great drinks, ambiance and service, and ofc super cheap compared to downtown bars. Laid back and usually not very crowded, I almost feel like I'm at a friend's house when I come here
author: Jessica S.

description: I came here with my friend and we got the strawberry tiki fire bowl. This place is pretty small so we had to wait a bit to find seating for two at one of their tables. It tastes pretty good, too good for you to believe that there's alcohol inside, which gets you! This didn't hit us while we were there but it definitely creeped up on us later lol. They have a deck of cards and maybe other games too, I forgot. But it's a good place to catch up with a friend or just hang out, as long as your group isn't too big. I'm not sure if I would make the trip to come again, since there are other tiki drink places in the Bay Area, but if I'm in that area, I would come back to get another tiki bowl!
author: Bailey L.

description: Not bad. I like the theme here(think pacific islander). The cocktails are okay. I think everybody gets that lava fire something or another. I got the...hmmmm I forgot. had some vodka and something juice in there.
author: Selby C.

description: We were running an errand in this neighborhood and stumbled upon Tiki Haven just as they were opening.  Being big tiki fans, we decided to check them out.  Excellent selection of classic drinks and creative drinks.  I had a Mai Tai to start which was excellent.  Then we shared a fire bowl which was equally good.  The bar tender was very friendly and helpful and seemed to know a lot of the people by name.  We felt right at home.  He also gave us some suggestions for where to go for dinner.  I think we need to find more excuses to run errands in this neighborhood so that we have a reason to come back.
author: Greta R.

description: I honestly can't wait to go back here. We strolled in on Sunday night after dinner with some friends and while the bar was somewhat empty, we still loved the décor and the service. I asked them if they could go "light" with my drink and sure enough, after recommending the Lava Flow, I was immensely pleased. Others in our party mentioned that the drinks were a tad bit on the sweeter side so you might want to be aware of that if that isn't your thing.
author: Shauna S.

description: This bar is so cute and all islandy themed! I came here with my family for drinks before dinner and they were so good. I don't remember the names but I'll post the picture because the glass was so cool. The bartender was super friendly and nice. She was really attentive and wanted to be sure everyone was enjoying themselves and their drinks. I would definitely come back here with friends because the full bar has something for everyone. Including lightweights who love fruity drinks like myself! I
author: Paula P.

description: Been to the tiki bar a few times. Depending on what time or day you go, the place can get really packed. The drinks are delicious and the service is friendly. Last time we went, we were able to get the Jenga game and play at the bar with new friends. Had a few different specialty drinks and all were blended nicely. If the bartender had excess mix, he gave us a second glass to scoop up what was left. Not many places do that.
author: Gaby E.

description: I really like this place and have been a few times. I like the Tiki Bowls and they're fun to share! I like the atmosphere and theme it has going, and the drinks that go along with it! The vibe is usually pretty low key and not too crowded, but I don't think I've been here on a weekend on the other hand. The bartenders are friendly as well. It definitely is dive-y in that it is situated in a rather random spot, but the inside is far from it. Check it out!
author: Elise S.

description:
In comparison to Trad'r Sams, this place is soooo much cleaner. The decor is nicer too.

My friends & I shared a couple Tiki bowls, which didn't taste spectacular or anything, but they did the job of getting you on a good buzz. They also have this cute little flame in the center of the Tiki bowls. Totally unnecessary, but its cute.

Typical SF street parking.

Overall great atmosphere.
author: Catheria S.

description: Great place to hang out!!! The bartenders are super sweet, especially the cutie called Stephanie. They have daily specials which all sounds great. And they have great music. There's a reason why I can't stop coming to this spot!
author: Anna Z.

description: This place is the perfect place to come for cheap drinks and catch a game. No food, but the staff is friendly and allow you to bring in food from outside stores. Come on tuesdays for their $1 off drinks. Perfect place to come chill for college students.
author: Marcus R.

description: You will never find a more wretched dive of a hive of Senior Citizens and Asian 20 somethings listening to really bad hop hop. We must be cautious.  Why are the cocktails so good :)
author: Ryan H.

description:
super hilarious: Friday at 5:30 - 4 guys and me waiting for Friday drink friend. 6:30 - 5 guys and me + friend; and I think they all knew each other.
Really, so super chill with the guys watching the basketball games, music not too loud, drinks good (like my fruit juice type cocktails) and suuuuuppppper chill. 
Will totally go back there to imbibe and just double-check it's always that mellow:)
author: Eos d.

description: Went here once as my 21st birthday celebration. I really liked their fruity drinks, like the bowl you can simultaneously drink through colorful straws with your friends. They have a lot of those "girly" drinks if that's what you're lookin for. I probably wouldn't go again but aye. No complaints about it, I left happy :D
author: Kaitlyn E.

description: Cool place! Shared a bowl with two other people though it tasted more sugary than alcoholic-y. We sat upstairs to play some games and had a good view of the entire bar. Love the decor and lights hanging up. It wasn't too busy here so it was a good place to hang out, and I'd definitely come back to check out their happy hour deals.
author: Jamie B.

description:
I just love this place because there's always a daily happy hour.

Maui Monday
$5 Cocktail specials

Tiki Tuesday
$2 Selected draft beer

Fire Bowl Wednesday
$5 off Fire Bowl from
4-12am

Thirsty Thursday
Extended happy hour

Get Leied Friday
We welcome you with a garland of flowers

Shipwreck Saturday
$5 Selected rum shots

Super Fun Day Sunday
$1 off all drinks all day

Happy Hour
4-8pm Monday through Friday.
$3 well/bottle/draught,
$1 off cocktails and
$2 off Fire Bowl

Another plus is that you can bring your own food. Since it's on Noreiga there's a whole bunch of restaurants close by. I am the girl who brings a half duck from Cheung Hing. I think the drinks here are okay. It depends on your bartender. They all make their drinks inconsistent of each other. The crowd here is a mix. I've been here on days when it's all college students, days when it's just me, and days when it's a just mix of people. But this bar tends to stay on the quiet side. There's also a few screen TVs so it's a nice place to come watch a game without the crowd. There's a $15 credit card minimum. 

FYI: There's only one bathroom but it's big and pretty clean.
author: Victoria C.

description: Great price, service, and bar! I love the Hurricane! Super yummy and strong! Would definitely come back soon.
author: John D.

description:
The Brady's warned not to touch the idol but we tried this place anyways!!!!

Cool as spot to celebrate with a group of friends!  It is so far away from the crowds that your can easily bring in a group of 8 and feel comfortable and get your drinks quickly.  It is the typical corny tiki bar with all the decorations but the drinks are strong, tasty and reasonable.  We will definitely come back!
author: Brian S.

description:
Avenue lounge is now Tiki Haven.. well it has been for quite some time now. The co-owner of Chug pub is said to have bought out this spot.. and added new decor and a cool vibe.

This place is back to its poppin ol self.. reminds me of the past years when it was still Aves and you would run into a bunch of old friends.. 

The drinks are average and the bartenders are friendly.

Overall cool joint.
author: Tiff C.

description:
Tiki Haven recently opened the upstairs room and that is exactly why I am updating my 4-star review to 5-stars! I'm a little hesitant to reveal the secret of the upstairs room but in my efforts to support local businesses, I guess I'm obligated to give this updated review.

I called on a Saturday afternoon to reserve the back table (with the board games) and was disappointed to see that it was taken when I walked in. The bartender was super apologetic and offered us the upstairs room instead. Total upgrade! We still brought up old school board games to play!!

The upstairs room is now my new favorite spot-- not to mention it's the perfect place to people watch too! Can't wait to go back for more yummy drrinks and good times!
author: Tiffany U.

description: Like the seating and love how it's spacious., my bartender was also a really pretty Asian girl  planing to come back for just a chill night with my girls and have anther volcano bowl
author: Gracelove C.

description: A fun little Polynesian/tropical dive. They only have one choice of wine, but that's not shocking. $6 for a generous pour. It was hopping on a Saturday night, but I could still carry a conversation.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Came here on a friday night to check out the newly remodeled bar.  I love the Tiki theme and the decor of this place is so cute and different.  People are super nice and attentive as well.  
  
Luckily my bf reserved a table, because the place was already packed, even at 10:30pm-ish.

Fire Bowls : $17, you can choose from different flavors.  We got peach and passion fruit.  6 girls, 2 bowls was a great start for the night.  The bowls weren't as big as I thought but it was definitely enough for us.  Those drinks were a creeper.  I love how they light the bread in the middle on fire, it was not what I've expected!

They have a lot of different tropical drinks on the menu but we didn't get to try them.  After 2 Fire Bowls, we decided to just chill and got a few pitchers of beer.

They also have board games and in our case we got to play some games on the tv screen in the back. I didn't play so can't give much details on that.

Overall I love this more than Avenue.  The crowd is different, the staffs are nicer.. it gives out a different but yet interesting vibe.  At least there's no fights :p
author: Anna W.

description:
Came in on a Wednesday around 9, and there were a few groups of people with big bowls of alcohol. Attracted by their tropical drinks and different daily specials, the boy and I dropped by for an after dinner drink.

On Wednesday, their signature firebowl punch is only $12 instead of $17, so we went for that...we asked for the pina colada mix (on their website they say you can have pina colada, but the menu at the place didn't have it). You can also choose strawberry, passion fruit, peach, etc... The drink was pretty huge. And it was super strong (even the boy said so and he's a heavyweight). Probably best shared by 3-4 people as most other at the bar were doing. It was so hard to make a dent in that bowl. Didn't really taste the pina colada...so I don't even know if it was in there...

Anyways, they have a ton of fruity tropical drinks that I would love to go back and try during happy hour. They also have a really cool high-tech touch screen jukebox, pringles dispenser, and flat screens to catch up on sports. 

Really chill place. By 10:15 it was pretty full for a Wednesday night. Service was good and friendly. Interior is clean and the decor is super kitschy but cute.
author: Katrina L.

description:
I love tiki bars!!! I love how Tiki Haven is close to me! Finally, a tiki bar in the Sunset!! I have been going to Trad'r Sams for a while, but I just lost interest. It's too far and the parking sucks. Tiki Haven is pretty cool. It gets crowded so try to come early if you want good seats. 

The Place: It's a bit small, but they have an upstairs (which I have yet to see because there was some kind of private party up there). You walk in and it's super narrow and difficult to maneuver through the crowd at the bar and from the tall bar seating to the side. Then it opens up towards the back where there are two benches along the wall with a small table, and then a table in the other corner that is sectioned off from the rest of the place. I wanted to sit there, but the group didn't budge the entire night. It would definitely come as early as you can if you want to sit down. It's fairly clean, but I'm assuming that's because it's new. I really like their tiki decor! My group sat on two tiki looking benches towards the back. It was ok, but kind of difficult to talk to everyone when we were separated on two benches. 

The Parking: It's actually not that bad. Noriega is a pretty busy street, but we were able to find parking right away on a Saturday night at around 10:30pm. 

The Bathrooms: There are 1 stall bathrooms for both men and women. Clean bathrooms with cute tiki door signs.

The Service: I wasn't buying the drinks, so I honestly don't know how the service is first-hand, but it seems fine. My boyfriend called it "regular bar service". I think what he meant was that they didn't talk too much or weren't completely friendly, but they took his order, made his drink, and handed it over while gladly accepting the payment. 

The Drinks: Pretty strong :) We got the Fire Bowl for $17. I shared it with one other person but others still came and sipped it a little. It was good and strong! Definitely creeps up on you, so be careful!! I don't remember the other drinks that were ordered, but the other cocktails were $8-$9

I would come back here, but I'd definitely come earlier and maybe on a weekday.
author: Lauren D.

description:
This was my first tiki bar... and maybe my last? I don't know, I'm not sure if I really fit into the tiki bar crowd. Well, at least I know I don't fit into THIS tiki bar crowd.

Drinks were good, bartender is very nice and cute, and the playlist was great (according to my friends who are a couple years older than me... pretty much every song reference went right over my head). The "Scorpion Bowl" is pretty fun! There's a fire in the middle and it's a communal drink. Can you say "mono"?

But in all seriousness, I can't help but feel a little sad in this place. I guess I imagined tiki bars to be a little more lively. It certainly is...festive, but I dunno if it's my favorite place in the world. 

No doubt I'll be back, though. Fruity drinks are totes my style.
author: Jade R.

description:
Went here on a Wednesday night over the summer and the place was filled. The drinks were good but the vibe was bizarre. This place is decorated like a retro dive bar, but the crowd was all hyper, early 20s guys and girls decked out in clubbing outfits. I'm not sure who was running the music, but it was mostly rap from artists like Tyga, so all night I could hear lyrical gems like "bounce on my dick" and "put that pussy on the floor." The decor is so kitschy and old-school that at first the music and crowd really threw me off, but later I realized that it made sense. After all, when tiki bars were first popping up in the U.S., the attitude toward women was basically the same. Way to keep the spirit of the mid-1900s alive, guys! :) 

In all seriousness, I think my friends and I unwittingly stumbled in on a college night. And that being said, I like dive bars, and I like that this one has board games and fruity drinks, so it might still be worth it to come back on a different night to see if the atmosphere is a little less intense.
author: Stephanie D.

description: Drinks weren't good.  Tiki Tea taste like medicine.  It wasn't to my taste.  Maybe ordering something else beside the Tiki drinks will be fine.
author: Minna S.

description: You probably already know this, but they have lots of specials and lots of pretty Asian, female bartenders. The drinks aren't too strong; in fact, they're quite sweet, and they have some really esoteric taps, e.g. multiple Kona ones, but it makes sense because of the theme of the bar. Pretty divey with lots of room to sit, so you're never really standing around. They only have about 2 bartenders on shift, even on the heavy days, so it might take a little longer to get a drink, but if you want a deal, shoot for 3 liters in the Tiki Barrel ($30). It's pretty easy to take down with a group of 3-4. Otherwise, grab a booth, knock a couple back, and maybe grab some savory snacks from the vending machine.
author: Danny C.

description: The decor is your normal fun tiki decor... Don't order a beer here though.  Ordered a Drakes denogginizer and it is $6 for what looks like an 8 ounce beer.  Nothing told me this before I ordered.  She explained that it's STRONG and tried to make me feel bad for even asking about the size... like I can't get a full denogginizer at a million places for $6 or less?
author: Chris M.

description:
There was a short spell of cold, foggy weather recently and I thought I was going to lose my mind--it was just one of those times where I needed some sunshine in my life and there was none, especially in the Outer Sunset. As I began fantasizing of tropical isles with white sandy beaches, crystal clear turquoise oceans, palm trees scattered about, and not a cloud in an endlessly blue sky; I stumbled upon Tiki Haven.

This oasis of a bar has just the tropical atmosphere I was craving. The establishment made me feel like I was in Hawaii. The bar tender was friendly and allowed me to taste the beer I was considering and was very attentive to all his customers. It is not necessarily a bar I plan to frequent, but I had a pleasant experience. 

Great place to visit if you need to escape from city life for a bit. Grass skirts and coconut bras, optional.
author: Timorei A.

description: This isn't your "lovingly crafted from fresh fruit" kind of tiki joint, but it's near the beach, and they've got a dive-y panache.  I'd definitely go back.
author: Rhett A.

description:
First off let me start by saying that.... I love this place!

Went here for my first time last night around 11:00pm.. was a little  worried about what kind of crowd it was going be but i must say it was a perfect mix of people. It was really chill for a Friday night but not to the point where its lame. Everybody was too themselves and having a goodtime..

I ordered the Passion Fruit Fire Bowl -  im not much of a drinker, i just like to get my buzz on! but The bowl was super cool & really tastey!  Not too strong but you can taste the alcohol. Shared it with 2 others & it was perfect! They have a few other flavors & a great selection of other yummy tropical drinks.

Very happy with this little Tiki Bar &&  I definitely will be coming back!
author: C A.

description:
This place is a really fun, intimate place to unwind with a couple of friends.  I would call it a dive bar, but it does tend to get pretty loud on certain nights.  You'll notice the tiki theme as soon as you walk in.  The decor and menu are all set around a Hawaiin theme.  The drinks are nice and stiff, but the service could be better.  Extra points for their tiki themed drinks.  There is something for everyone on the menu; even picky girls like this place.  Drink specials are good deals, but comparable to other bars in the area.  This is a full bar.  


PROTIP:  This bar attracts a majority of Asian people.
author: David C.

description:
First time here on Saturday

Not bad. Cleaner and less divey than Traders Sam

Drinks were cheap

Had the Firebowl and it was pretty good. Definitely gave me a buzzed.

They also have cool different drinks if you like fruity drinks.

If you want to go somewhere chill and just want to watch sports, then go to Tiki Haven.
author: Carol Y.

description: I live 3 houses down from this place. It just seems like a giant asian sausage fest every weekend, sometimes we get to see fights but they're pretty weak. Some drunks are disrespectful to the neighborhood. Cops came a few times outside are house because people be getting drunk courage and probably fight over the 1 or 2 girls in the bar. Those fish bowl things tho! Place has good lighting and friendly bartenders. Check out ones bar a block up, it's a new spot that opened November 2014. Tiki lounge has good areas for groups, one in front and back, but there's mainly all guys here.
author: Rob T.

description:
This is my kind of bar. Well, it's a bar for anyone who likes both relative solitude and fruity drinks. My friend and I went in on a Saturday night and there were only about 8 people inside at 9 pm. It's a nice quiet place to have flaming drinks and play board games, with none of the sticky tables and standing room only of more popular tiki places. Dang their restroom was ghetto though, there was no toilet seat and it was filled with kegs. The drinks themselves are not bad. We got a strawberry fire bowl and I got sufficiently sauced. I like the fact that both a BofA ATM and Safeway are within stumbling distance so that I can buy donuts for my drunchies. Good times were had; I will be back. 

P.S. It's not a crouton they set on fire, it's a bit of sponge. I worked up the courage to poke it after the flame went out.
author: Skye L.

description: Tiki Haven is a great Happy Hour spot. I love meeting friends here and grabbing a drink. The atmosphere is chill and it's hawaiian themed!  We usually end up getting a firebowl which is delicious. Well priced and friendly bartenders. I'll continue to go here!
author: Sandhya R.

description:
Empty on a Monday night, but better for me because my friend and I could just sit there and catch up! :) They have specials every day of the week (including weekends)! Monday nights are Maui Mondays, so we got two Pina Coladas. They were pretty good, didn't taste strong at first but will hit you at the end (or maybe cause I'm a lightweight... so don't quote me on this). 

The bartenders were really nice and love the atmosphere. Will definitely come back on a Wednesday night to take advantage of their Fire Bowl special! $5 off, so there! :)
author: Michelle L.

description: Really odd place. I don't know what it is with SF and their super divey tiki bars. Trad'r Sam's can make it work on occasion, but places like this or bamboo hut just leave me feeling skeezed-out. I'd rather go to a true dive bar or a real tiki joint. There is no need for so many hybrid spots. But hey, if you're going to school at SFSU I could see this being cool for those youngsters since it's somewhat nearby (given its slim pickings the closer you get).
author: Katie S.

description:
I remember when this place used to be Avenue Lounge. Now, its Tiki Haven. The gf and I went to check this place out since we were in a drinking mood. The place was pretty crowded when we dropped by on a Thursday night. 

To me, it seemed more of a place for young college guys to come and chill at after work or after midterms/finals. The decor is nice, the staff are friendly and I ran into a few high school classmates here. Just happen to be in the neighborhood you know? 

Drinks: Decent, I can't complain. I was able to relax a bit since I've been tense all week. I ordered a Cadillac Margarita, but it seemed like the bartender didn't really know how to make it. Too much salt at the bottom of the glass. 

I had a good time, 4 drinks that night and the stumbling around in the street before KO-ing somewhere where I don't remember. xD
author: Jason C. J.

description:
I went to this place expecting something like Trad'r Sam's, which is one of those defining hangout spots of the USF experience. This experience is as follows: going out, cramming 8 people into a table meant for 3, getting hammered with three friends, getting hammered again on a grasshopper and then stumbling 15 or so blocks to the Jack-In-The-Box down Geary. After eating a disgusting selection you awaken to a splitting headache vowing never to do so again, and then you repeat a month and a half later after the shock has worn off. It's a very intense experience, but also a lot of fun, and for better or worse it's colored my experience of Tiki bars.

Tiki Haven is quite the opposite. It's a relaxed little spot nestled between small Asian restaurants in the Sunset, and while the drinks are strong (both the bowls and the the cocktails, as evidenced by my Hurricane), the atmosphere is not. Young professionals, some in Hawaiian shirts (for which you get a discount) milled about the bar area, and we found a Connect Four board nestled in the corner by a table.

We drove in quite a ways to get to this place based on something we'd heard from my friend. While I don't think it was worth the drive (there's not really anything around it except Asian restaurants) it is a relaxig little haunt to enjoy if you live in the area. But why on earth, when they serve you the bowl that we got, do they light a crouton on fire and stick it in the middle?
author: Andrew B.

description: Small little bar place that has a hawaii theme looking with dim lights in the inside. Since i came here with my relatives, we only order beers so i didn't get to try their other drinks. We bought KFC hot wings before coming since they don't sell food here and since one of my cousin knew the owner, we were allow to bring our food inside and ate it with our beer. This place has one small lounge where it's good for big group but you'll have to come really early if you want the lounge area. Everything else are a few long tables and stool chairs and the bar area. I would definitely come here to try out their other drinks
author: Julie N.

description: Yummy scorpion bowls. But they aren't nearly as strong as Tradr Sams but similar price. Fun, low key atmosphere.
author: Anastasia P.

description:
Fire bowl: sell out. For $17 you get a bowl of alcohol with a chunk of pineapple that's been set on fire. Really? SELL OUT! 

The crowd is a bit strange too on a Friday night. It was mostly an older crowd. Didn't vibe off anyone =\
author: Serena F.

description: I never knew about this place! Got here! It was beautiful! Very nice service. The woman that works there is very nice and cute :) lol
author: Rex C.

description:
Tiki bars always make me happy.  One of my favorites is Ohana in Seattle.  Every time I go there, I always wish that we had more cool tiki places in San Francisco.

Anyway, popped in here for happy hour the other day.  With the loss of Lost Weekend (eons ago), the sunset has not had a good tiki bar in ages.

So happy to see that Tiki Haven is now open and I really liked what they did with the decor.  The bartender (also one of the owners), Terence, was really cool and did a great job with the varied clientele, keeping everyone happy.

It was early evening so the place wasn't really jumping yet, but it definitely looked to be a fun place, especially with a group of friends.

Great tropical and non-tropical drinks, as well as happy hour specials.  Was going to give it a four, but I've always had a soft spot in my heart for tiki and something about the place makes me smile so I'm up'ing it to a five. 

Just can't help but be happy drinking tropical drinks in a Gilligan's Island themed bar, an exceptional escape from the foggy sunset.
author: Roy N.

description:
Prepare to get leid...

out!! The old Avenue bar has been revamped into a tiki themed haven. The drink menu offers a wild array of island themed cocktails and other tiki concoctions. The drinks seem light and unassuming at first but they do pack a punch. Their signature drink is the Fire Bowl, which is delivered flaming to your table. Don't go overboard or you will be knelling before the porcelain god.

The bartenders were nice and attentive and the bar fills up past 10pm on a Saturday night. Dice and an array of board games like Operation, Connect Four, and Jenga are available for you to play.
author: Sam T.

description:
Stopped here on our way to Toyose for dinner and was totally blown away.

Great place, appropriately tacky Tiki decor (and I'm patenting that phrase!!!! :D) and a wonderful, gregarious owner who really took the time to talk to us and tell us a little about the neighborhood and the bar.

Try the Fire Bowl.  Don't ask questions.  Do it :)  We tried the passion fruit flavor and it was so delicious.  But be warned - it is a lot of alcohol and it sneaks up on you.  But it's not as "in-your-face" as a Long Island ice tea (same ingredients but this tastes so much better and nowhere as vile!!!)

Again, decor is totally island themed.  And my word, they have a Pringles dispenser.  I can't say I have ever seen one of these before and it was quite the find :)

I'd definitely go back here.  It's just off 19th Ave so it's not a big detour at all.  And parking in the area is usually quite easy.

If you haven't been here, try it - you'll enjoy it.  If you have, you already know :)  On some nights, I think you get a discount with a student ID.

~ 5 stars - I love little bars like this with that personal touch.  

# 246
author: Badri N.

description: I used to come here all the time when it was Avenue.  The bar layout is basically the same.  Just tiki'd up.  I like it when it was Avenue, so I still like it now that it's Tiki.  I haven't really tried any of their drinks, but I just come here for the normal drinks like Grey Goose.  A fun place to go and an alternative to Firefly when I wanna stay local!
author: Elena N.

description:
It was one of those Saturday nights. Friends planned to get together, but didn't have any real plans to do anything. 

So we drove into the city, some light traffic, and a few text messages later we ended up in the Sunset. At Tiki Haven.

It was interesting. The whole tropical facade was nice. It was not crowded, which was a bit unexpected for a Saturday night. 

We ordered a couple of beers and a fire bowl. The beers were standard. The fire punch bowl was intimidating at first, the whole flaming piece of pineapple in the center, and the concoction of mixed alcohols seemed dangerous for my stomach. Turns out it was pretty tame. It was $17 and we shared it between 3 people. 

 Overall the Tiki Haven was pretty tame, but it definitely kicked off an amazing night.
author: Karma B.

description:
Although the Hawaiian themes interior may look a tad bit cheesy, my party and I love to come here. There's always free tables and chairs to accommodate all size parties. The air is casual and their Hawaiian themed specials are quite enjoyable. This is quite an inexpensive place to come kick back and relax. 

Bartenders here range from poor and inefficient to quick and fun. I ordered 7 shots of goose and each one contained various amounts, not to mention, it took her quite a long time. Good thing there was jenga to keep us distracted. The other bartender was really precise and got everything down to a T.

Great local joint. Random vending machines in the back have hawaiian inspired snacks for those who have mini munchies.
author: Sue T.

description: This place is nice if you just want a sweet fruity drink. Maybe I haven't come on the right nights but its usually an odd mix of people. I don't go here too often but if I am around and in the mood for a sweet cocktail, I'll check it out.
author: Star M.

description:
Came here for happy hour on a Thursday night. 

My friends and I already knew what we wanted, which was one of the fire bowls. 

After looking at the menu, we figured out how much the drink would be so we could pull out our $$

When we ordered, the waitress told us a completely different price for the bowl. 

She CLEARLY did not know how much the bowl was for happy hour. When I asked if it was the price I saw on the menu, she said um, ok, sure. 

Dude get it together Tiki Haven. It was EMPTY when we were there and your waitress can't get her prices straight.
author: emily f.

description:
i'm a big fan of tiki bars...

..especially those big bowl of liquor drinks where it says "recommended for 8 people" but there's only 2 of you and you drink it anyway and its a good fucking night

easy to find parking, get drinks, and attentive, pretty bartenders.  what more can you ask for? there's even a vending machine to get snacks in the back.  friday nights are get lei'd nights.  everyone gets lei'd.
author: Christopher N.

description:
Tiki Haven is a tiki bar? I didn't see a single tropical drink being drunk here. We stopped by here around 9pm on a Friday for a quick drink. The place was empty. Everyone seemed to be regulars and no one was ordering actual Tiki drinks. Oh well.

The music was someone's iPod plugged into the sound system and played mostly Drake songs. 

I do love the vending machine though! They had Hawaiin chips and a bunch of Asian snacks, including spicy dried squid! You know you are in the Sunset when...
author: Joshua C.

description:
DRINKS:
haha they have those funny Island cocktails.. It was novel, and it was not bad. 

SERVICE:
great. friendly bartender sandra.


ATMOSPHERE:
Hawaiian themed, cute dive bar. Almost feel like you're on vacation. Second story in back looking down at the bar
author: Angela L.

description: This place is a gem.It is the most  authentic Tiki bar I have ever been to (besides the Tonga Room ).The  Tiki  drinks are much  better and cheaper than the drinks at the Tonga  Room. I feel like I am in paradise every time I come here.
author: Alexa S.

description: island themed bar along typically cold noriega...a small tiki haven to find warmth and shelter...an empty evening before late dinner...clean and tidy interiors...pale stained wooden props...casual and hawaiian feel...taking bar seating...single bartender serving...good selection of whiskey and scotch...owner seated at bar drinking...shot of jagermeister and pint of pabst for $six special?...a fool for specials and taking...shot of licorice black and sip of cold pale tasteless pabst...small chit chat and hangin'...good company making cheap beer and shot better...
author: Hen A.

description:
The first impression is "Wow, that's a lot of Asian men in their 20's wearing North Face jackets."  That feeling is so strong that it precedes, "Oh, this bar has a Tiki theme."
Within a minute of loitering at a tall boy with no stools, one of the bartenders offered us a Tiki totem bench and pulled up a table and low stool to go with it.  He took our orders, 2 jack n' cokes, and one hastily chosen Mai Tai, if one has to be tropical, and brought them over ($20 total).
The Mai Tai tasted as if someone had crushed an orange Smartie into it--sort of powdery taste that was probably curacao or triple sec.  I wouldn't say that it tasted bad, I just don't like Smarties.  If we'd been hungry, there was a multi-flavor Pringle dispenser, a vending machine with all the classics--peanuts, cheez its, microwave popcorn--and a convenient microwave to make good on it.  And within 20 minutes, the bartender came over to offer up a bowl of peanuts, in the shell.
For a neighborhood bar on Noriega that isn't yet overcome by midafternoon-drunk regulars, I like it. It's clean, well lit, has some classic board games, soon to be released from their plastic shrinkwrap, and really friendly, attentive servers.  I would not say that it's worth waiting for the 71.
author: Laura S.

description: Cute Tiki lounge with bowls of sweet alcohol! The place was cute, I ordered the lava flow and it was way too sweet! The bartender was nice enough to take it back and she tried her best to make it less sweet but it was just too sweet for my taste, sorry. But I give them 3 stars for the great customer service and hey they have beer and other cocktails
author: Karen T.

description:
Tiki haven in my opinion is the new spot to be!

A whole bunch of mixed, "tropical" drinks that are pretty tasty but pack a punch! I recommend the "Wiki Waki Woo", "Almond Enjoy", and "Gilligan's Island"! Those drinks are HELLA good! 

In the back, they also have a bunch of board games that you can easily turn into a drinking game. Hahaha

Seriously... What more do you need?
Good drinks... Check!
Games... Check!
Good decorations... Check!
Friendly bartenders and owners... Check!!
author: Matt W.

description:
Another cool small tiki bar! No matter how generic tiki bars can be, they are always hella fun and different from regular dive bars (yet there all the same, get it). Thought i was checking out a new bar, but when I got into Tiki Haven it looked really familiar to me and i realized it used to the The Avenue? Been there once before so it was funny seeing the place turned into a tiki bar.

The usual stuff inside a tiki bar - decked out with decorations, the regular tiki bowls and tiki cocktails on the menu. They have daily deals, but they're not all day so you have to make sure you go during the right time to get the deals. There's a booth in the very front and in the very back and the rest of the seating is at the bar and just bar tables on the other side.

Tradr Sams is still the best Tiki bar in the city, but tiki haven is still a spot I'd go to because it's closer to me. It's pretty similar to the tiki lounge in san mateo...they use the same exact bowls and drink cups.
author: Arnold N.

description: I like this place, it's my kind of bar to be honest.  The owners are cool, the decor cheesy but fun (I'm a big Hawaii fan), mixed crowd but mellow, and everyone just want to chill and drink.  Plenty of TV's to watch sports, and that oh so cool snack vendor selling dried cuttle fish!
author: Joel M.

description:
I went here on my birthday and had a blast!

The bartenders were really friendly and quick to serve us some powerful drinks. We got several rounds of the Fire Bowl and each one tasted better than the last (effect of alcohol?) 

They don't serve food here, but thats ok here because there is a vending machine here filled with all the munchies you could want while drinking. 

We didn't hang out upstairs because it was filled with people but thats ok, we needed to be close to the bar anyway. 

All in all, love the tiki theme. They have TVs here if you need to watch sports. They have music if you want to boogie down. 

Thanks Tiki Haven, I'll return next time I visit SF!
author: Vincent L.

description: Tiki-tastic! To be fair, I should say that most tiki bars, just by virtue of being a tiki bar, score a minimum of 3 stars in my book. What put this place over the edge to 4 stars was the friendly bar tender, the nice crowd, the reasonably priced and strong drinks (took a friend out and for the two of us, I only spent $30...and we were pretty tipsy darn tipsy after the $30 of drinks), and the cute/semi-divey atmosphere. They also take credit cards which is always a nice surprise.  Since I don't live too far away, I can say with pretty good certainty that I will be back to have another fruity, yummy (and strong!) beverage!
author: Rebecca H.

description:
Specialities are Board Games and monster drinks that requires straws and helping mouths. 

We ran into this place after munching down some dessert from the near by store. The staff seemed friendly enough, but we were the early patrons so attention was showered upon us. Later in the night, the place got pretty full, maybe it was the narrow space between the bar and side tables that made it cramped. 

Prices are reasonable.
author: Uland W.

description:
Pretty awsome place for a somewhat cheesy tiki bar. This place is definately an upgrade over the old Avenue here. Bartenders are lookin pretty fly with great service and pretty attentive. They have plenty of Island themed drinks. Their signature, the "firebowl" you may want to try it if your a first timer. And also if you want to share, order a "tikibowl" good for 2-3 people. 

Postives - bartenders, tv's, theme

negatives - bathroom (but most bars have janky bathrooms)
author: Steve T.

description: Cozy and probably the most well lit bar I have ever been to.  I like the atmosphere and all the tiki stuff. And the Giligins Island and Lava Flow Tiki drinks for $8 were okay.
author: Sheenie L.

description:
First night in San Fran we were looking for a a Tiki Bar close to the hotel, at 1.6 miles Tiki Haven was the closest and easiest to get to so....

I feel like  I have to qualify the three star rating - Tiki Hut didn't do anything wrong except miss the mark a bit for me on Tiki expereince. It was clean, well lit and the bartender was SUPER friendly and very nice. But it kinda felt like a sports bar with tiki heads thrown in.....

Drinks: Taste, value, drinking pleasure. The drinks were fine. To be honest they jsut weren't memorable in anyway. But they were fine. Everyone else was drinking beer.

SCORE: 6

Decor: Looking for Unusual, evocative, fun, cheese factor. In my evaluation "cheese" was a plus!!!!!  Tiki Haven's decor was just too regimented and matchy-matchy. After expereincing Frankies in Vegas with tons of original art I was looking for some originality. Tiki Haven's decor appeared to have come from a "Buy a Tiki Bar" set. 

SCORE: 5

Bartender and staff: Two primary criteria here: Mixology skill and aloha spirit.  The bartender had the Aloha Spirit - friendly,warm, chatted us up about other Tiki bars in the area (That she didn't go to but heard about). I watched her handle a somewhat difficult customer very graciously. I docked her points here becasue she didn't seem to know much or really care about the drinks or the mixology and was just following a recipie - I just don't think Tiki or perhaps even cocktails - were her "thing" (The entire context of this review is Tiki)

SCORE: 7

Price: I evaluated price with the understanding that Tiki drinks ARE pricey and I was in expensive cities. We hit Tiki haven duing some kind of happy hour, the drinks were reasonably priced

SCORE: 7

Overall: This was the most subjective category and scored solely on how much I enjoyed myself at the bar. All the other criteria impacted the overall score. Tiki Haven was fine, and is probably a great neighborhood bar, but it is not a destination bar, I wouldn't make an extra trip to go here again. 
SCORE: 7

Total Score:32
author: Meaux C.

description: Came here on a Friday night for my birthday... place wasn't dead but it wasn't packed either, which is pretty good I guess. Got two of the fire bowls, one was mango and the other was passion fruit. Mango is definitely a favorite but the passion fruit wasn't bad either but you taste the alcohol more in the passion fruit, so it depends on the individual I guess. Drank these two back to back with my friends (after drinking sojo at another place for a while) and everything just went downhill after that. Not sure if the bowls were that effective since I wasn't feeling anything from the sojus... but after we finished the second fire bowl, I... had to use the bathroom and you get the picture! The other drink I don't remember since my taste buds were basically dead that night after. Prices aren't cheap at tiki haven, but they aren't insane either... but tradr sams is cheaper. The bartenders are a little bit slow too, my friends and I were just watching them... usually bartenders multitask and are fast... not here, which seems very laid back. Worth a try I guess, if you're in the area!
author: Johnson S.

description:
Yay! I just wish this place was bigger but it has upstairs too.
Friend recommended this joint and I'm sooo glad I live right by it! 
The drinks are tropical blend but you can also get your typical beer and mixed drinks. Bright and festive.

A drunk man wouldn't leave me alone. I was standing on the street waiting for a friend to arrive but he kept telling me about he just move into the Richmond and how he "loves the beach and shit" and "shit like that." I really wanted him to go away. But at least he was friendly and not causing any problems
author: Veranna N.

description:
Tiki Haven is a cool bar to chill at with your homies. 

Love the Tiki/ Luau theme, and they have different specials each night. 

My favorite is the Wyder's Pear Cider - light and refreshing. There's also a "Fire Bowl" if you want some fun to share. 

Check this place out, it'll be fun! Good music and drinks = a good time!
author: Sharon L.

description: I come here for the proximity to my house (2 blocks) and the delicious fruity drinks- NOT for the locals or the employees. Went on a Friday night and they did last call at 1:15 when the bar was not busy at all (having plenty time to get drink orders in well before 2 am). By 1:30 obviously closing down and turning on and off light and signs right next to customers, even asking us to move over so they could reach a light bulb. By 1:40 they were all yelling to finish drinks. We got the hint that everyone wanted to leave early so we didn't even finish our drinks and walked out. Very unprofessional and rude and didn't get that feeling of a local neighborhood bar should be giving. When I asked about the bar closing at 2 am they made some excuse on how much time it takes to close up and even shouted "BYE!" in a rude tone as my friends and I walked out. Every other bar in the Sunset does last call by 1:30 at he earliest to close by 2. Unhappy local:(
author: Nicole K.

description:
This place is weird.  I mean, I find all tiki bars weird and most in a good way. But  I'm not sure how to feel about this place. It has all the typical tiki decorations and 2 floors. They only have one big table  on the first floor (which was reserved) and seats at the bar and small tables that seats 3. Anyways, they have a menu that lists tropical and fruity rum-based cocktails as well as bowls. $8 for a cocktail doesn't seem too bad but it's still a bit hard to justify. First, the barteneders (however attractive) don't know how to make their drinks. Ok , I understand that each cocktail consists of multiple ingredients but it looks so unprofessional to have to reference a cheat sheet in front of your patrons. They also don't smile. Maybe a bad day? Second, the drinks aren't strong but what do you expect for $8, right? They do have board games like battleship and Jenga. We played jenga and the loser had to take a shot of rum so it made the time pass.

Place can get packed since it's rather small. Crowd is diverse which makes it more fun to people watch.
author: Steven L.

description: good service, but they could do better mixing drinks, shake the drinks... shake the goddamn drinks, don't just pour then re-pour.  if you're a goddamn bartender then do your fucking  job
author: Sa V.

description: Grabbed a beer here and met up with a friend.  Small bar that doesn't have much, but is a nice place to meet up a friend and talk if you dont want the rowdiness of a bar.
