Beers are extremely cheap and I would come here again if I were to meet up with someone to grab a beer again.  Other than that, I can't really review it much more.  I will make an update once I go there again!
author: Best T.

description: This is a pretty chilled Tiki bar. Came to this place because friends from socal really wanted a big bowl of drink! Yelped it and found TIki Haven. Never knew that this place existed until now and I will definitely return. If you wear hawaiian outfits, automatic discount! Theres also specials that go on during certain days and hours. Last time we came we were able to get those big bowls on fire for about 10 bucks a pop! Drinks are good and I definitely recommend the Pina Colada flavored Tikibowl!
author: Sappho C.

description: Went for the first time on Saturday night to meet some friends & [continue to] celebrate my husband's birthday. Our friends had nabbed the booth at the front by the door--great location. Great mai tais and pina coladas, mellow island decor. Will return when in the mood for island drinks.
author: Ali W.

description: I came in with a few friend to try a new bar. It was highly rated by one of our friends. I don't know if this is the watering hole for the high schools around there, but the general age of people there seemed very young. I ordered a beer and then decided to leave because it felt like there was so much teenage angst going on.
author: Eric M.

description: I was very excited to try this place but it was definitely not what I expected. Based upon the exterior of the bar and their tiki-tastic website, I was expecting a tropical oasis. They did a nice job with the interior and they seem to be serving the proper tiki drinks, but the ambiance was just not what I was hoping for. The lighting as a little bright, first of all. Most upsetting was the modern digital jukebox on the wall that seemed to be blaring exactly the opposite type of music one might expect for a place like this. I forgive the sports on tv, but the music really did not fit the atmosphere. Also, the Mai Tai was just so-so which is a problem for a tiki bar. I really wanted to like this place, but it was just not quite right.
author: Anne Y.

description:
I've been wanting to come here for awhile after passing it by so many times and finally got to go a couple of weeks ago on a Saturday night with boyfriend and one of our friends. 

There were a couple of people who looked like they were loitering in front but they ended up being the bouncers... They were playing a lot of hip hop which inside isn't what you'd expect at a tiki bar but whatever, the drinks are not too expensive, the bartenders are nice and the alcohol per drink ratio is pretty good. We got a few frozen drinks, some big ass shots, and a strawberry flavored "firebowl" which was good. They have different specials every day which is cool and the upstairs of the bar was awesome! When we came we had the upstairs to ourselves to sit and catch up, drink, and play games like jenga and break the ice. A lot of the games were missing pieces but still we had a good time and will definitely be back!
author: Jess H.

description:
i remember when this spot use to be "avenue" bar/lounge before when it was all dark and gloomy in there and the bar top was kind of run down with some seating on the side and no lights at all. 

since then, they changed it to Tiki Haven and it looks so much better. theres always times where you run into some friends there or some people celebrating a bday or even getting drunk for no reason.

their new twist to drinks and those bowls are pretty good. the bartenders are nice and i think one of them i've met before too? not sure.

service was good and they got specials for every day of the week. on saturday it was $5 capt-mo shots! damn that would mess you up ... haha

besides that, i like this place a lot better than before, definately.
author: Kenny L.

description: Fire bowl! The coolest thing to order here. They have an upstairs to this place with some games to play like cards, dominoes, and jenga. A great place to chill and hang out with friends and share a cool firebowl or have individual drinks.
author: Claudia M.

description:
yay for $1 off all drinks on sundays!

every time i go, at least one of us has to get absolutely hammered.

how i drove home, i have no idea....


tiki theme is kinda random. but who can complain about party bowls drinks? just make sure your friends don't have mono or stuff.
author: Ben T.

description: Gives Trader Sam's a run for it's money. It was less crowded, takes credit cards and has decent prices. We also got lei'd on a Friday night :)
author: M S.

description:
It was a late Sunday evening, so there was plenty of street parking.

Type of food:  Bar

Ambiance:  Like I said before, it was a Sunday night- so the place was not very crowded but there were still people there.  I liked the quiet and chill atmosphere.  It was a nice time to catch up and chat with friends.  
I love the Tiki decor.  There seems to be a lot of "tiki" spirit since the people working there were all wearing leis. We sat in the back where there were two tables and a long bench.  It felt like we were in a private area.  I liked that they had board games for entertainment but it made the environment feel a bit tacky.

Service:  Only 21+ are allowed in.  They checked ID at the door, but it doesn't seem like they are that strict. There were friendly two bartenders who greeted us.  Since it was a slow night, the service was quite fast. They brought out our drink in less than 10 minutes.  

Taste:
The menu has a lengthy list of tropical drinks to match the decor. They even have special deals on the weekdays (check their website).  
Our group decided to settle for the "Fire Bowl" since they are infamous for it and it seems like a good size to share among our group of 5. The Fire Bowl is described as "our signature blended punch made with rum, vodka, and gin with cranberry and your choice of fruit wild berry, pina colada, strawberry, peach, or passion fruit. This drink packs a punch as well. Served in a large volcano tiki bowl with a fiery surprise. Serves 2-4 people."  We decided to go with the passion fruit because it sounded exotic.  It was good, sweet, but I didn't really taste the alcohol.  It looks like cocktail bowls from Tradr Sam's (but their drink is way more intense).  Besides that, it's called FIRE bowl because they light a pineapple at the center of the bowl.  Interesting, but the fire went out after 2 minutes. The bowl looked different and cool, but I could have lived without it.  I rather have a stronger kick.

Price:  As mentioned before, they have weekly specials that seems to be a good deal. The Fire Bowl was $17.  It's a bit pricey for juice and a tad of alcohol.  

Overall:  I would definitely like to come back on a Friday or Saturday because it seems like a fun place to hangout with young adults.  However, even on slow days like Sunday, it seems like a fun place to just chill and relax since there were plenty of empty tables and it wasn't very noisy.  I'm giving it 3.5 out of 5 stars because the cocktail wasn't as infamous as it seems.  Also, I didn't feel the fun bar vibe; but that may change if I decide to come another day.
author: Tiffany L.

description: I came here with a few friends after dinner on a Friday night. It wasn't very busy but still the service sucked. The bartender pretty much ignored us. We were finally able to order our drinks after like 10minutes. We got a pina colada fire bowl and a wiki waki woo. The wiki waki woo was pretty good but the pina colada was pink and nasty. I dont think pina colada is suppose to be pink and it tasted like rubbing alcohol. Never coming back to this place again. I should have listened to my friends and gone to the tiki bar in San Mateo instead.
author: Stephanie L.

description: For a hangout place to grab a few drinks with friends, it's not bad. It's kinda cool they have a different theme going on. However, it still feels dirty like any other bar, especially with young drunks spilling their drinks all over the tables and floor. Staff though is nice. The Fire Bowl had a strong alcohol taste, I didn't like it. The fire in the middle had no purpose really.
author: Cristal G.

description: This place is better than Ave Lounge...still small but its pretty chill..they bartenders are kinda slow...three of them and I waited hella long for a drink...worth a try...i think its the same owners as chug pub....
author: Brendan L.

description: If you don't like the crowd at Tradr Sams this is the only place nearby that offers the same kind of scorpion bowls. Though they are not as strong as Tradr Sams its a cool place to hang out and actually sit down at.
author: nabil s.

description:
came by Tiki Haven, but to be honest, I feel like the Tiki crowd will need some reassuring..

seemed like a mostly beer drinking crowd, but the Tiki menu looked definitely legit!

Will have to give this place a 2nd chance...
author: Carlos C.

description: Yay!!  Fifty times better than when it was Avenue Bar.  Same management as Chug Pub...Chug Pub got 5-stars from me and so does Tiki...!!  Come in and look for John...tell him Patrick sent you...he'll give you a discount...muahahahaha...
author: Patrick C.

description: Legit place, good drink, friendly bartenders/ owners, and great happy hour!
author: Drew F.

description: This is an alright bar. It's fun looking inside, but it seems to attract the same people, and the bartenders are not entirely the most friendly.
author: Emily B.

description: i come here if i want to meet up wif my friends or get away from boom lol
author: Linda A.

description: mixed drinks are bleh, so just stick with beer. its nice to have a place where you can drink, be loud and play board games!
author: kim w.

description: Only been here once but will surely return. Nice tiki decor, friendly bartenders, good prices on tropical drinks, lots of happy hour specials, and if you wear a Hawaiian shirt in during the week you get happy hour prices any time. Glad it's in the neighborhood!
author: L J.

description: Man reading through some of these reviews some people are a little too picky. This place is freaking awesome, I had a great time! The drinks were strong and flavorful, the service at the bar was top flight, even on a super busy Friday night I still felt like we were getting good service, and the ambiance is awesome, I don't feel like there is a fight going to break out at this place like 90% of the other bars in the city. Chill even when busy. Walked out lit, perfect for before dinner drinks, try to get here around 9ish to avoid the crowds, cause it will get crowded.
author: Jeremy B.

description: MG is awesome!!! She knows how to make a great Fire Bowl!!
author: Evelyn V.

description: Re-writing my review for now because the kind bar manager, T, has politely and courteously helped to refund me. It hasn't yet gone through, but he was very kind in hearing me out and accommodating me. I'd suggest getting a new POS system that doesn't make those mistakes. I'll update this again when the refund goes through.
author: nightlife i.

description: Nice decor!  A variety of mixed drinks!  Clean bathroom!  This bar is the place to be!
author: Priscilla L.

description: Love this dive bar.  Very different and well lit.  You can actually see people's faces in here.  The bartenders are all nice and cute.  They always have some drink specials going on.  We come here like at least twice a week.
author: Jonathan K.

description: thank you johnny, terence, and tim for doing such an awesome job at reviving this neighborhood bar.  i absolutely love coming here to hang out with friends and for their really well made and tasty cocktails.  love their martinis!  the bartenders, especially mary, are super friendly.  just a wonderful, fun place to relax from a hard week!
author: Yan K.
